result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Barron

DTC - PHASE  1

Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

TURN OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR PLACEMENT. UPON PLACEMENT BAIL IS TO CONVERT TO $250.00 PR BOND WITH TURNOVER JUSTICEPOINT.   As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Juan Barron in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Juan Barron in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan Barron appeared by video means with Attorney.
The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

AS TO COUNT ONE; The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months. 

Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury Instructions.  Received and Filed.  nk

received and filed
Defendant is eligible for DTC. Case adjourned for entry.

Defendant Juan Barron in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski; both appear by video. Defendant Juan Barron in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to  Judge Franke. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Matter is adjourned to the trial court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Juan Barron not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Poznanski is newly appointed counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan Barron not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for State V-LEE hearing in the trial court.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan Barron not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan Barron not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  SPD has not appointed counscel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Marshalls, Ryan R., and Luis R. Court advised defendant that failure to comply may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Juan Barron in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Juan Barron in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
